title: How to Create 'On My Way' Message Templates
description: Look professional and help customers prepare with a quick heads-up text.

steps.title: Create your OTW template
steps.description: Write a short message to send when you're heading to a job.
substeps: Keep it simple: 'Hi [Name], this is [Your Name] from [Business]. I'm on my way and should arrive in about [X] minutes. See you soon!'
Or even simpler: 'On my way! ETA 15 minutes. - Mike'
Include your name so they know it's not spam
steps.tip: Customers love knowing you're coming. It's a small thing that makes a big impression.

steps.title: Save it as a text shortcut
steps.description: Type 3 letters, get the full message.
substeps: iPhone: Settings → General → Keyboard → Text Replacement
Phrase: 'On my way! Should arrive in about XX minutes. - [Your Name]'
Now typing 'otw' auto-expands to your full message

steps.title: Android alternative
steps.description: Set up a similar shortcut on Android.
substeps: Add your OTW message with shortcut 'otw'
Or use an app like Texpand for more control

steps.title: Send it every single time
substeps: When you leave for a job, send the text immediately
Update the ETA based on actual drive time
If you're running late, send an update
This takes 10 seconds and makes customers happy

steps.title: Automate with your CRM (optional)
steps.description: Some tools can send this automatically.
substeps: Jobber/HouseCall Pro: Enable 'On my way' notifications
Tap one button when leaving and it sends automatically
Even better: GPS triggers the message when you start driving

successMessage: You now have a professional 'on my way' system! Customers will notice the difference.
proTips: Always overestimate your ETA slightly — better to arrive early than late
If you're running behind, text them before they text you
This tiny habit separates pros from amateurs in customers' minds
